subtitleNullable: Macroeconomic data and election dates for sone West African countries
descriptionNullable:
This dataset contains data on various macroeconomic indicators and election dates in selected West African countries which will be used to test for evidence of political business cycle in future papers.

The Political Business Cycle is a concept in political economics used to refer to a phenomenon when a pattern of good economic performance can be detected during periods of election. It can be caused by various reasons:

1. The activities and expenditures that comes with the electoral process.

2. Bribery and corruption.

3. An effort by the incumbent government to increase desirability with voters.

4. Weak separation of power and independence of central bank.

You can use this data to explore the patterns of macroeconomic performance in West Africa. You can also check it's relationship with election date.

The data can also be used to practice various time series, geospatial analysis and panel data techniques. The data can also be used to show how data science techniques can be applied to econometric problems.
title: Electoral Business Cycle in WAMZ
